summary: Analyzed forward/backward interdependence in truth lemma proof. The interdependence for imp case is inherent to mutual induction technique (not fixable). Evaluated 5 alternatives: two separate inductions (impossible), restricting to non-temporal formulas (narrower result), omega-saturation (fundamental circularity), Henkin-style (major refactoring). Recommends accepting current state: documented temporal sorries with sorry-free completeness is the most elegant approach.

artifacts.summary: Comprehensive analysis of alternative proof techniques for overcoming forward/backward interdependence, evaluating 5 approaches with feasibility assessment

approaches_evaluated.name: Two Separate Inductions
approaches_evaluated.reason: imp forward inherently needs backward IH

metadata.key_insight: The forward/backward interdependence in imp case is inherent to mutual induction, not a proof engineering issue. Temporal sorries are separate omega-rule limitation.
